title.narrative: SECTORAL INFO. SYSTEMS ON CHILD RIGHTS

description.narrative: National sectoral information systems have access to and capacity for incorporating disaggregated data on issues pertaining to child rights in the country

sector.narrative: Administrative data, registers and non-MICS household surveys and censuses
Stimulating demand for and capacity to use data

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National sectoral information systems have access to and capacity for incorporating disaggregated data on issues pertaining to child rights in the country

description.narrative: National authorities have increased capacity to produce consolidated and disaggregated data on child rights. MONSTAT, in cooperation with UNICEF, completed and published the data from the latest round of the Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS), which yielded important, new data on status of children, women and families in Montenegro. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:26/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of child-rights-based indicators incorporated in Social Welfare Information System (SWIS)
Availability of data on children participating in justice processes in Judicial Information System (PRIS)

baseline.value: Data on children in conflict with the law available

target.value: 2021:Data on all children participating in justice processes available

actual.value: 2019:Within the ongoing process of development of the new judicial information system (ISP) led by the Ministry of Justice jurisdiction, a set of common indicators for children participating in judicial proceedings (criminal, civil and administrative) was developed with UNICEF technical support and v

title.narrative: Sex and age disaggregated data on violence, exploitation and abuse of children are routinely collected, analyzed and published and used to inform national planning processes

actual.value: 2019:The assessment of VAC definitions, indicators and data measurement tools completed. Recommendations provided for consolidation of the definitions and indicators across the sectors and further alignment with global measurement tools and standards.
